cards.name: Acidic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: This permanent deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}, Sacrifice this creature: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature or player."
cards.flavor: The first sliver burst against the cave wall, and others piled in behind to deepen the new tunnel.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Amok
cards.text: {1}, Discard a card at random: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText: {1}, Discard a card at random: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.flavor: Crovax's rage was horrifying. Within moments only blood and shreds of flesh remained of the shapeshifter.

cards.name: Awakening
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, untap all creatures and lands.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, untap all creatures and lands.
cards.flavor:
"There are times when destiny calls forth a people and demands an action. Now is the time. We are the people. This is our action. Charge!"
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.

cards.name: Bandage
cards.text:
Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Takara shook with guilt. She knew the last image her father had seen was her sword flashing toward him.

rulings.text: You draw the card when Bandage resolves, not when the damage is actually prevented.

cards.name: Bottomless Pit
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player discards a card at random.
cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor:
"I'm sure it came with the place. I don't think you build one on purpose."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: The ability is controlled by the player who controls Bottomless Pit. This means that Bottomless Pit can trigger abilities which trigger off an opponent forcing you to discard.

cards.name: Brush with Death
cards.text:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target opponent loses 2 life. You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target opponent loses 2 life. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Bullwhip
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Bullwhip deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Bullwhip deals 1 damage to target creature. That creature attacks this turn if able.
cards.flavor:
"Pain is a crude way to enforce obedience, but it is cheap and plentiful."
—Volrath

rulings.text: If the creature can attack, it must. If it cannot, then nothing happens.

cards.name: Burgeoning
cards.text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever any opponent plays a land, you may choose a land card from your hand and put it into play.
cards.flavor:
"The plants said, ‘We will fight the stone with root and stem and seed. We are patient. We will win.'"
—Skyshroud myth of the forest

rulings.text: Playing a land will trigger it, but putting a land onto the battlefield as part of an effect will not.

cards.name: Calming Licid
cards.text:
{W}, {T}: Calming Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature can't attack.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Calming Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature cannot attack" instead of a creature. Move Calming Licid onto target creature. You may pay {W} to end this effect.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Cannibalize
cards.text: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Exile one of those creatures and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.
cards.originalText: Choose two target creatures controlled by any one player. Remove one of those creatures from the game and put two +1/+1 counters on the other.
cards.flavor: "Mine."

rulings.text: You choose the two target creatures during announcement. You choose which gets the counters and which is to get exiled on resolution.

cards.name: Carnassid
cards.text:
Trample
{1}{G}: Regenerate Carnassid.
cards.originalText:
Trample
{1}{G} Regenerate Carnassid.
cards.flavor: The hunter would never forget the time or place where he first met the carnassid, for they buried him there.

cards.name: Change of Heart
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature can't attack this turn.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target creature cannot attack this turn.

rulings.text: Change of Heart will not remove an already attacking creature from combat. It must be cast before attackers are declared or it won't have any noticeable effect on the game.

cards.name: Cloud Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
Clouds are the soil, dreams are the crop.
—Kor saying

rulings.text: If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

cards.name: Constant Mists
cards.text:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land. (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText:
Buyback—Sacrifice a land (You may sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs when you play this spell. If you do, put Constant Mists into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Contemplation
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever you successfully cast a spell, gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"How fascinating it is to watch the machinations of one's own mind play themselves out."
—Volrath

cards.name: Contempt
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature attacks, return it and Contempt to their owners' hands at end of combat.
cards.originalText: If enchanted creature attacks, return that creature and Contempt to owner's hand at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"Predictable little man. In all these years you taught me so much yet learned so little."
—Volrath, to Starke

cards.name: Conviction
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return Conviction to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W} Return Conviction to owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It was not the minotaur's shoulders but his soul that bore the heaviest weight.

cards.name: Convulsing Licid
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Convulsing Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature can't block.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Convulsing Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature cannot block" instead of a creature. Move Convulsing Licid onto target creature. You may pay {R} to end this effect.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Corrupting Licid
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Corrupting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}: Corrupting Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature cannot be blocked except by artifact creatures and black creatures" instead of a creature. Move Corrupting Licid onto target creature. You may pay {B} to end this effect.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Craven Giant
cards.text: Craven Giant can't block.
cards.originalText: Craven Giant cannot block.
cards.flavor:
What is high as a mountain and low as a snake?
—Dal riddle

cards.name: Crossbow Ambush
cards.text: Creatures you control gain reach until end of turn. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText: All creatures you control can block creatures with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
There is no drake that flies faster than a crossbow bolt.
—Vec saying

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Crovax the Cursed
cards.text:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Crovax the Cursed counts as a Vampire.
Crovax comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.
During your upkeep, sacrifice a creature and put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax, or remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B} Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Crovax can sacrifice itself to its upkeep triggered ability.
You can only sacrifice one creature to it each turn.
If you choose not to sacrifice a creature and he has no +1/+1 counters, then nothing bad happens. Note that some other effect must be keeping him alive if he has no counters.

cards.name: Crystalline Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText: Slivers cannot be the target of spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: Bred as living shields, these slivers have proven unruly—they know they cannot be caught.

rulings.text: The ability only applies while this card is on the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Dauthi Trapper
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: Merfolk tell their young of Dandân, humans of Rag Man. Dal tell tales of the Dauthi, and they are far worse.

cards.name: Death Stroke
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home. As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.

cards.name: Dream Halls
cards.text: Rather than pay the mana cost for a spell, its controller may discard a card that shares a color with that spell.
cards.originalText: Instead of paying the casting cost for a spell of any color, its caster may choose and discard a card that shares at least one color with that spell. If the spell has {X} in its casting cost, X is 0.
cards.flavor: Within without.

rulings.text: This only replaces the mana cost (the mana in the upper right hand corner of the card). It will not pay additional costs from the card text (such as Buyback) or from other effects. It does not prevent you from paying those additional costs if you want or need to.

cards.name: Dream Prowler
cards.text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
cards.originalText: Dream Prowler is unblockable as long as no other creatures are attacking.
cards.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath

cards.name: Duct Crawler
cards.text: {1}{R}: Target creature can't block Duct Crawler this turn.
cards.originalText: {1}{R} Target creature cannot block Duct Crawler this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The mountain's ducts will be like organ pipes, amplifying the glorious roar of the dying."
—Stronghold architect, journal

cards.name: Dungeon Shade
cards.text:
Flying
{B}: Dungeon Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B} Dungeon Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A sickness stirs in its eyes, a nightmare born in darkened wails.

cards.name: Elven Rite
cards.text: Distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.
cards.originalText: Put two +1/+1 counters, distributed any way you choose, on any number of target creatures.
cards.flavor: As the bough stretches, so shall you grow. As the roots spread, so shall you thrive.

cards.name: Endangered Armodon
cards.text: When you control a creature with toughness 2 or less, sacrifice Endangered Armodon.
cards.originalText: If you control any creature with toughness 2 or less, sacrifice Endangered Armodon.
cards.flavor: These are its last days. Its doom to be remembered only until the hunters hunger again.

cards.name: Ensnaring Bridge
cards.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
cards.originalText: Each creature with power greater than the number of cards in your hand cannot attack.
cards.flavor:
"I expected a fight, but I didn't expect it from the building itself."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: All creatures on the battlefield (including yours) are subject to the restriction based on the number of cards in your hand.
It only checks the cards in your hand when declaring attackers. Once they are declared, changes to your hand size or to the power of the creatures will not remove creatures from the attack.

cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.originalText: Return all creatures to owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The first step of every exodus is from the blood and the fire onto the trail.

cards.name: Fanning the Flames
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Fanning the Flames deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Fanning the Flames deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Flame Wave
cards.text: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
cards.originalText: Flame Wave deals 4 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
cards.flavor:
"I hear the roaring of a wave whose waters are red and whose mists are black."
—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Fling
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: It's raining rats and moggs.

rulings.text: The sacrificed creature's last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking creature during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that creature is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Flowstone Blade
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R} Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Remember the fable of the elf who came upon a cave of gold. In trying to free the largest piece, she was crushed by its weight."
—Karn, silver golem

cards.name: Flowstone Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flowstone Hellion is unaffected by summoning sickness.
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Volrath leaves no stone untrained.

rulings.text: It will be put into its owner's graveyard as soon as one of its abilities resolves that puts its toughness at zero (or less than the current amount of damage on it). This is a state-based action, so there is no way to activate its ability any more to increase its power further before it is put into the graveyard.

cards.name: Flowstone Mauler
cards.text:
Trample
{R}: Flowstone Mauler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Trample
{R} Flowstone Mauler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Once these horrifying creatures were perfected, there was no need for armodons.

cards.name: Flowstone Shambler
cards.text: {R}: Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {R} Flowstone Shambler gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Flowstone troops are notoriously difficult to keep in formation.

foreignNames.name: 流動石のシャンブラー

cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Foul Imp comes into play, lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

printings: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

cards.name: Furnace Spirit
cards.text:
Haste
{R}: Furnace Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Furnace Spirit is unaffected by summoning sickness.
{R} Furnace Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If it can survive the Furnace, you don't want it near you.

cards.name: Gliding Licid
cards.text:
{U}, {T}: Gliding Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Gliding Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Enchanted creature gains flying" instead of a creature. Move Gliding Licid onto target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Grave Pact
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature you control is put into any graveyard, each other player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

cards.name: Hammerhead Shark
cards.text: Hammerhead Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.originalText: Hammerhead Shark cannot attack unless defending player controls any islands.
cards.flavor: Cross the eyes of a hammerhead and you'll dot its teeth.

cards.name: Heartstone
cards.text: Activated abilities of creatures cost {1} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.
cards.originalText: The cost of each creature ability requiring an activation cost is reduced by {1}. This cannot reduce an ability's generic mana cost to less then {1}.
cards.flavor:
"Finding a true heartstone is even harder than finding a true heart."
—Hanna

rulings.text: The cost reduction can be applied to additional costs.
It will not add a {1} to abilities with no generic mana in their activation cost.
It will never reduce any colored mana portion of an activation cost.
Can't reduce Snow mana costs.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder texts.

cards.name: Heat of Battle
cards.text: Whenever a creature blocks, Heat of Battle deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature blocks, Heat of Battle deals 1 damage to that creature's controller.
cards.flavor: "Takara, it's me!" shouted Starke. It was no use—she obeyed Volrath.

cards.name: Hermit Druid
cards.text: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a basic land card. Put that card into your hand and put all other revealed cards into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.

rulings.text: You can put the cards from your library into your graveyard in any order.

cards.name: Hesitation
cards.text: When a player casts a spell, sacrifice Hesitation and counter that spell.
cards.originalText: If any spell is played, counter that spell and sacrifice Hesitation.
cards.flavor: Gerrard hesitated, looking up at the enemy ship. The future hesitated with him, changed forever by the pause.

rulings.text: Playing a land is not casting a spell, so playing a land will not trigger this card.

cards.name: Hibernation Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "Pay 2 life: Return this permanent to its owner's hand."
cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "Pay 2 life: Return this creature to owner's hand."
cards.flavor: Mogglings have been known to play ball with hibernating slivers, completely unaware of their true nature.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Hidden Retreat
cards.text: Put a card from your hand on top of your library: Prevent all damage that would be dealt by target instant or sorcery spell this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose a card in your hand and put it on top of your library: Prevent all damage from an instant or sorcery. (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
cards.flavor: After an hour in the hidey-hole, Squee seriously pondered the advantages of danger over boredom.

rulings.text: This can be used on damage to a creature or player.
This can be used on instant or sorcery spells on the stack, but not on abilities.

cards.name: Honor Guard
cards.text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {W} Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It is not a choice I make, to have this guard. It is the choice of my people, and my duty to them."
—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Horn of Greed
cards.text: Whenever a player plays a land, that player draws a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever any player plays a land, that player draws a card.
cards.flavor:
"Rath grows, and I am nourished."
—Volrath

rulings.text: Playing a land will trigger it, but putting a land onto the battlefield as part of an effect will not.

cards.name: Hornet Cannon
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying and haste named Hornet onto the battlefield. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Put a Hornet token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 artifact creature with flying that is unaffected by summoning sickness. At end of turn, destroy the token.
printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition

cards.name: Intruder Alarm
cards.text:
Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, untap all creatures.
cards.originalText:
Creatures do not untap during their controllers' untap phases.
Whenever any creature comes into play, untap all creatures.
cards.flavor: Mirri was startled by Volrath's apparition—it had no scent.

rulings.text: If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at one time, this ability triggers once for each creature. This doesn't matter much, but it can in some cases.

cards.name: Invasion Plans
cards.text:
All creatures block each turn if able.
The attacking player chooses how each creature blocks each turn.
cards.originalText:
Each creature blocks whenever able.
Attacking player chooses how each creature blocks. (All blocking assignments must still be legal.)
cards.flavor: Gerrard studied the globe as Mirri kept watch. Suddenly, his eyes widened. "This is Dominaria!"

cards.name: Jinxed Ring
cards.text:
Whenever a nontoken permanent is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, Jinxed Ring deals 1 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Ring. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText:
Whenever any card is put into your graveyard from play, Jinxed Ring deals 1 damage to you.
Sacrifice a creature: Target opponent gains control of Jinxed Ring permanently

cards.name: Lab Rats
cards.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Put a 1/1 black Rat creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Put a Rat token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 black creature.

cards.name: Lancers en-Kor
cards.text:
Trample
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Lancers en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.originalText:
Trample
{0}: Redirect 1 damage from Lancers en-Kor to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: Nearly all sets of Kor twins are trained as lancers.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

cards.name: Leap
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Mirri leapt quickly and silently. The guard died likewise.

cards.name: Lowland Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText: Whenever Lowland Basilisk damages any creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.

rulings.text: If a creature leaves the battlefield before the end of combat, then the Lowland Basilisk effect on it will end.
If it damages a creature outside of combat, its effect will destroy the creature at the end of the next combat.

cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional {3}.
cards.flavor:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

cards.name: Mask of the Mimic
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Mask of the Mimic, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a card with the same name as target nontoken creature and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Search your library for any copy of target creature card and put it into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

rulings.text: You look for a card of the same name, the current type of the card does not matter.
You do not have to find a card if you do not want to.

If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: Whenever any opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to him or her.
cards.flavor: "You can run from your pain," explained Gerrard to Crovax, "but take it from experience: you will tire before it does."

cards.name: Mind Games
cards.text:
Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Mind Peel
cards.text:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {2}{B}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B}{B} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target player chooses and discards a card.

cards.name: Mindwarper
cards.text:
Mindwarper enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mindwarper: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText:
Mindwarper comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Mindwarper: Target player chooses and discards a card. Play this ability as a sorcery.

cards.name: Mob Justice
cards.text: Mob Justice deals damage to target player equal to the number of creatures you control.
cards.originalText: Mob Justice deals 1 damage to target player for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: A single stone can start an avalanche.

rulings.text: Creatures are counted on resolution.

cards.name: Mogg Bombers
cards.text: When another creature enters the battlefield, sacrifice Mogg Bombers and it deals 3 damage to target player.
cards.originalText: If any other creature comes into play, sacrifice Mogg Bombers and it deals 3 damage to target player.
cards.flavor: Behind every great mogg bomber is another mogg with a shovel and a basket.

rulings.text: The Mogg Bombers do trigger on any creatures that enter the battlefield at the same time they do.
If multiple creatures enter the battlefield at the same time, the ability triggers once for each of them. You may choose a different target player for each time it triggers.

The damage is dealt whether or not you sacrifice the Mogg Bombers. For instance, if Mogg Bombers is destroyed or sacrificed in between the time when the ability triggers and when it resolves, then the targeted player will still be dealt 3 damage.

cards.name: Mogg Flunkies
cards.text: Mogg Flunkies can't attack or block alone.
cards.originalText: Mogg Flunkies cannot attack or block during a turn in which no other creature you control attacks or blocks.
cards.flavor: They'll attack whatever's in front of them—as long as you tell them where that is.

rulings.text: Mogg Flunkies can be declared as an attacker only if another creature is declared as an attacker at the same time. Similarly, Mogg Flunkies can be declared as a blocker only if another creature is declared as a blocker at the same time.
Two or more Mogg Flunkies can attack or block together.

Although Mogg Flunkies can't attack alone, the other attacking creature(s) doesn't have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Mogg Flunkies could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls.

In a Two-Headed Giant game (or in another format using the shared team turns option), Mogg Flunkies can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

printings: Premium Deck Series: Fire and Lightning

cards.name: Mogg Infestation
cards.text: Destroy all creatures target player controls. For each creature that died this way, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield under that player's control.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures target player controls. For each creature put into any graveyard in this way, put two Goblin tokens into play under that player's control. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures.

cards.name: Mogg Maniac
cards.text: Whenever Mogg Maniac is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent.
cards.originalText: Whenever Mogg Maniac is dealt damage, it deals an equal amount of damage to target opponent.
cards.flavor: Stand clear if he gets an itch.

rulings.text: If it blocks a trample creature, it only gets dealt damage equal to what is assigned to it. This means it will likely only get to deal 1 damage to the opponent.

cards.name: Morgue Thrull
cards.text: Sacrifice Morgue Thrull: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Morgue Thrull: Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: It's so hard to find good help these days.

cards.name: Mortuary
cards.text: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put that card on top of your library.
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature is put into your graveyard from play, put that creature on top of your library.
cards.flavor:
"Think of them not as failures but as works in progress."
—Volrath

rulings.text: This is not an optional ability.

cards.name: Mox Diamond
cards.text:
If Mox Diamond would enter the battlefield, you may discard a land card instead. If you do, put Mox Diamond onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
When Mox Diamond comes into play, choose and discard a land card or sacrifice Mox Diamond.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

rulings.text: If you don't discard a land card, Mox Diamond never enters the battlefield. It won't trigger abilities that look for something entering the battlefield, and you won't get the opportunity to tap it for mana.

cards.name: Mulch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top four cards of your library to all players. Put any of those cards that are lands into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Hope is the one crop that can grow in any climate.

cards.name: Nomads en-Kor
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Nomads en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.originalText:
{0}: Redirect 1 damage from Nomads 
en-Kor to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: The Kor forsake roots for the winding of the path; forsake voices for the silence of the mind; forsake all else for the poverty of isolation.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

cards.name: Overgrowth
cards.text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, it produces an additional {G}{G}.
cards.flavor: Life needs no encouragement.

rulings.text: This is a triggered mana ability.

cards.name: Portcullis
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, if there are two or more other creatures on the battlefield, exile that creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control when Portcullis leaves the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever any creature comes into play, if there are two or more other creatures in play, set that creature aside. If Portcullis leaves play, put the creature into play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Creatures which are phasing in will not trigger this card's ability.
If the creature that triggered Portcullis is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then it fails to do anything.
You check the count of the number of creatures on the battlefield again during resolution. The creature will not be exiled if the count is 2 or less.

The creature does enter the battlefield, so any other abilities that trigger on it entering the battlefield trigger. This follows the normal rules for timing triggered abilities: first, the current player puts his or her abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. Portcullis' own ability is included in this, so it could result in the creature being exiled after some abilities have resolved, but before others.

The "when Portcullis leaves the battlefield" ability is set up as part of the ability that exiles the creature. It will trigger when Portcullis leaves the battlefield even if Portcullis has somehow lost its abilities at that time.

cards.name: Primal Rage
cards.text: Creatures you control have trample. (If a creature you control would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
cards.originalText: All creatures you control gain trample.
cards.flavor: "Charge!" A great cry went out, and countless elves and Vec soldiers charged up the mountain. Their fury and passion hid the fact that they were horribly outnumbered.

cards.name: Provoke
cards.text:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Untap target creature you do not control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.

rulings.text: You can target an untapped creature.

cards.name: Pursuit of Knowledge
cards.text:
If you would draw a card, you may put a study counter on Pursuit of Knowledge instead.
Remove three study counters from Pursuit of Knowledge, Sacrifice Pursuit of Knowledge: Draw seven cards.
cards.originalText:
Skip drawing a card: Put a study counter on Pursuit of Knowledge.
Remove three study counters from Pursuit of Knowledge, Sacrifice Pursuit of Knowledge: Draw seven cards.

cards.name: Rabid Rats
cards.text: {T}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Every sentence in Volrath's prisons ends the same way.

cards.name: Ransack
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of those cards on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

cards.name: Rebound
cards.text: Change the target of target spell that targets only a player. The new target must be a player.
cards.originalText: Target spell, which targets only a single player, targets another player of your choice instead.
cards.flavor: Insult, like an arrow, is beyond control once loosed.

rulings.text: You can't use this on a spell unless the target spell is an Aura or uses the word "target" in its text. If it isn't an Aura and the word "target" is not there, then the spell does not target a player at all—it just affects a player without targeting them.

cards.name: Reins of Power
cards.text: Untap all creatures you control and all creatures target opponent controls. You and that opponent each gain control of all creatures the other controls until end of turn. Those creatures gain haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText: You and target opponent each untap and gain control of all creatures the other controls until end of turn. Those creatures are unaffected by summoning sickness this turn.

rulings.text: It is perfectly legal for either or both players to have zero creatures. They give control of all their zero creatures as instructed.
You only untap creatures controlled by you and the targeted opponent, not all creatures.

cards.name: Revenant
cards.text:
Flying
Revenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Revenant has power and toughness each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Not again."
—Hans

cards.name: Rolling Stones
cards.text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
cards.originalText: Walls can attack as though they were not Walls.
cards.flavor: Walls collapse and kill people all the time. Some are just more aggressive about it.

cards.name: Ruination
cards.text: Destroy all nonbasic lands.
cards.originalText: Destroy all nonbasic lands.
cards.flavor:
"We have built a wall upon sand. The wall will vanish. The sand will remain."
—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Sacred Ground
cards.text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever an effect controlled by any opponent puts a land into your graveyard from play, put that land into play.
cards.flavor:
"That which knows itself cannot be shaped to another's will."
—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Samite Blessing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, prevent that damage."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains "{T}: Prevent all damage to any creature from any one source." (Treat further damage from that source normally.)
cards.flavor:
Knit bone, darn flesh,
Stitch skin, weave breath.
—Samite healing ritual

cards.name: Scapegoat
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Scapegoat, sacrifice a creature.
Return any number of target creatures you control to their owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Return any number of target creatures you control to owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Enjoy your deception, Vuel," Gerrard said as Volrath's features melted from the dead shapeshifter. "I'll count this one as practice."

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Seething Anger
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.originalText: When Serpent Warrior comes into play, lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: A hiss before dying.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.name: Shaman en-Kor
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Shaman en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
{1}{W}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that damage is dealt to Shaman en-Kor instead.
cards.originalText:
{0}: Redirect 1 damage from Shaman en-Kor to a creature you control.
{1}{W} Redirect to Shaman en-Kor all damage dealt to any one creature from any one source.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

cards.name: Shard Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
{R}{R}{R}: Return Shard Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{R}{R}{R} Put Shard Phoenix into your hand. Use this ability only if Shard Phoenix is in your graveyard and only during your upkeep.
Sacrifice Shard Phoenix: Shard Phoenix deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

rulings.text: You can return Shard Phoenix any time during your upkeep; this is not a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.
Shard Phoenix uses Last Known Information. If, for example, it was blue when it was sacrificed, the damage will come from a blue source.

cards.name: Shifting Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Shifting Wall enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.originalText:
Shifting Wall counts as a Wall. (Walls cannot attack.)
Shifting Wall comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor:
"You'd almost think Volrath doesn't want me here."
—Gerrard

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying

cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then choose and discard a card.
cards.flavor:
"Twice I have let the Legacy slip away. Never again."
—Karn, silver golem

cards.name: Silver Wyvern
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Change the target of target spell or ability that targets only Silver Wyvern. The new target must be a creature.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{U} Target spell or ability, which targets only Silver Wyvern, targets another creature of your choice instead. Play this ability as an interrupt.

rulings.text: You must pick a legal target when redirecting the spell or ability.

cards.name: Skeleton Scavengers
cards.text:
Skeleton Scavengers enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
Pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on Skeleton Scavengers: Regenerate Skeleton Scavengers. When it regenerates this way, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Skeleton Scavengers comes into play with one +1/+1 counter on it.
Pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on Skeleton Scavengers: Regenerate Skeleton Scavengers and put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Skyshroud Archer
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with flying gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with flying gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In Rath, arrows are guided not by virtue but by necessity.

cards.name: Skyshroud Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Skyshroud Falcon to tap.
cards.flavor:
The falcon slits the sky to let the light drip through.
—Kor saying

rulings.text: No it is not a Falcon creature type. It is a Bird.

cards.name: Skyshroud Troopers
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
cards.flavor:
"We were not made for war. Like flowstone, Volrath shaped us to it."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

cards.name: Sliver Queen
cards.text: {2}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Sliver Queen counts as a Sliver.
{2}: Put a Sliver token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 colorless creature.
cards.flavor: Her children are ever part of her.

cards.name: Smite
cards.text: Destroy target blocked creature.
cards.originalText: Destroy target blocked creature.
cards.flavor:
"You've got your childhood wish at last. Now you get to die."
—Gerrard, to Volrath

rulings.text: A "blocked creature" is an attacking creature that has been blocked by a creature this combat, or has become blocked as the result of a spell or ability this combat. Unless the attacking creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocked creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures that blocked it are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat by then.

cards.name: Soltari Champion
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Champion attacks, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
If Soltari Champion attacks, all other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spike Breeder
cards.text:
Spike Breeder enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a 1/1 green Spike creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Spike Breeder comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Breeder: Put a Spike token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 green creature.

cards.name: Spike Colony
cards.text:
Spike Colony enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Spike Colony comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Spike Feeder
cards.text:
Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.
cards.originalText:
Spike Feeder comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Gain 2 life.

cards.name: Spike Soldier
cards.text:
Spike Soldier enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Spike Soldier gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Spike Soldier comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Soldier: Spike Soldier gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Spike Worker
cards.text:
Spike Worker enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Worker: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
cards.originalText:
Spike Worker comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Worker: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Spindrift Drake
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Spindrift Drake unless you pay {U}.
cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, pay {U} or sacrifice Spindrift Drake.
cards.flavor: Sea brine for blood, washing foam for laughter.

cards.name: Spined Sliver
cards.text: Whenever a Sliver becomes blocked, that Sliver gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.originalText: If any Sliver is blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.

rulings.text: If two Spined Slivers are on the battlefield then each blocked sliver gets +2/+2 for each creature blocking it.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, ‘Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm

cards.name: Spirit en-Kor
cards.text:
Flying
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Spirit en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{0}: Redirect 1 damage from Spirit en-Kor to a creature you control.
cards.flavor:
Death free throat from thirst, mouth from speech, feet from earth.
—Kor requiem

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

cards.name: Spitting Hydra
cards.text:
Spitting Hydra enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spitting Hydra: Spitting Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature.
cards.originalText:
Spitting Hydra comes into play with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spitting Hydra: Spitting Hydra deals 1 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Stronghold Assassin
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

cards.name: Stronghold Taskmaster
cards.text: Other black creatures get -1/-1.
cards.originalText: All other black creatures get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"With the completion of each joyous task, we are closer to Yawgmoth's divine vision."
—Stronghold architect, journal

cards.name: Sword of the Chosen
cards.text: {T}: Target legendary creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target legend gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: One shard of Selenia yet remained.

cards.name: Temper
cards.text: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.originalText: Prevent up to X damage to target creature. For each 1 damage prevented in this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor:
"I don't need a plan, just a goal. The rest will follow on its own."
—Gerrard

rulings.text: You can make X be larger than the amount of damage, but you only get one counter for each actual point of damage prevented.
The +1/+1 counters do show up at the same time as any unprevented damage, which means they are there before you check for lethal damage.

cards.name: Tempting Licid
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Tempting Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Tempting Licid loses ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so" instead of a creature. Move Tempting Licid onto target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell being countered on resolution for having no legal targets.

cards.name: Thalakos Deceiver
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Thalakos Deceiver attacks and isn't blocked, you may sacrifice it. If you do, gain control of target creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Sacrifice Thalakos Deceiver: Gain control of target creature permanently. Use this ability only if Thalakos Deceiver is attacking and unblocked.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.name: Tidal Surge
cards.text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
cards.originalText: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
cards.flavor:
"It is nature that gives us our boundaries and nature that enforces them."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

cards.name: Tidal Warrior
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land is an island until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The tide of battle favors those who can swim.

cards.name: Torment
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
cards.flavor:
"Volrath has killed me. All that remains of me is the scar!"
—Tahngarth

cards.name: Tortured Existence
cards.text: {B}, Discard a creature card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: {B}, Choose and discard a creature card: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"There are terrors lurking in the unseen corners of us all."
—Crovax

rulings.text: You can't return the same card you are discarding. This is because you pick the target before paying the costs.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.
printings: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

cards.name: Verdant Touch
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Target land becomes a 2/2 creature permanently. (This creature still counts as a land.)

rulings.text: The land is still a land and retains all its abilities, plus any other characteristics.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Victual Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: You gain 4 life."
cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}, Sacrifice this creature: Gain 4 life."
cards.flavor: "We are kinfolk," explained Karn to the sliver queen. "Just as you need your progeny to complete you, so do I need the pieces of the Legacy to make me whole."

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn’t provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it’s no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.name: Volrath's Gardens
cards.text: {2}, Tap an untapped creature you control: You gain 2 life. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText: {2}, Tap a creature you control: Gain 2 life. Play this ability as a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Watch yourself," warned Starke. "These plants aren't nice when they're hungry."

cards.name: Volrath's Laboratory
cards.text:
As Volrath's Laboratory enters the battlefield, choose a color and a creature type.
{5}, {T}: Put a 2/2 creature token of the chosen color and type onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
When you play Volrath's Laboratory, choose a color and a creature type.
{5}, {T}: Put a token creature into play. Treat this token as a 2/2 creature of the chosen color and creature type.

rulings.text: The token has the same name as the creature type.
The token does not have any built-in abilities. For example, choosing creature type Bird does not give the token Flying.

cards.name: Volrath's Shapeshifter
cards.text:
As long as the top card of your graveyard is a creature card, Volrath's Shapeshifter has the full text of that card and has the text "{2}: Discard a card." (Volrath's Shapeshifter has that card's name, mana cost, color, types, abilities, power, and toughness.)
{2}: Discard a card.
cards.originalText:
As long as the top card of your graveyard is a creature card, Volrath's Shapeshifter is a copy of that card, except that Volrath's Shapeshifter retains its abilities.
{2}: Choose and discard a card.

rulings.text: If the top card in the graveyard has any other undefined characteristics, then those characteristics are not acquired and the shapeshifter uses the characteristic from its own card.

If the top card in your graveyard is a creature card, this card uses the listed characteristics, including color and any other types. But, this card keeps the granted ability in addition to those from the card being copied.
When it changes forms, any "enters the battlefield" abilities of the card it "copies" do not trigger.
A copy of a Volrath's Shapeshifter will have the shapeshifting ability.

If the top card in your graveyard isn't a creature card (meaning a card with the type Creature, which may or may not have other types such as Artifact or Enchantment), then it's just a 0/1 blue creature. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
The ability that sets its characteristics is a text-changing effect.

cards.name: Volrath's Stronghold
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{1}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The seed of a world's evil.

cards.name: Walking Dream
cards.text:
Walking Dream can't be blocked.
Walking Dream doesn't untap during your untap step if an opponent controls two or more creatures.
cards.originalText:
Walking Dream is unblockable.
Walking Dream does not untap during your untap phase if any opponent controls two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: Dreams, by definition, live shorter lives than those who dream them.

cards.name: Wall of Blossoms
cards.text:
Defender
When Wall of Blossoms enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
When Wall of Blossoms comes into play, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Each flower identical, every leaf and petal disturbingly exact.

cards.name: Wall of Essence
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Essence is dealt combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
For each 1 combat damage dealt to Wall of Essence, gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
The ceiling and the floor fell in love, but only the wall knew.
—Dal saying

rulings.text: Wall of Essence’s triggered ability will trigger even if it’s dealt lethal damage. For example, if it’s dealt 7 combat damage, its ability will trigger and you’ll gain 7 life.

cards.name: Wall of Razors
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
First strike
cards.flavor:
"In this blessed structure let the very walls baptize themselves in the blood of intruders."
—Stronghold architect, journal

cards.name: Wall of Souls
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Souls is dealt combat damage, it deals that much damage to target opponent.
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
Whenever Wall of Souls is dealt combat damage, it deals an equal amount of damage to target opponent.
cards.flavor:
"It is the nature of evil to turn you against yourself."
—Starke

rulings.text: Redirected damage is still combat damage, so it will trigger on combat damage that is redirected to it.

cards.name: Wall of Tears
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Tears blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat.
cards.originalText:
(Walls cannot attack.)
If Wall of Tears blocks any creatures, return each of those creatures to owner's hand at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"Many have been lost to pity."
—Karn, silver golem

cards.name: Warrior Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Warrior Angel deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.originalText:
Flying
For each 1 damage Warrior Angel deals, gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: She represents not hope, but hope's desperate fury.

cards.name: Warrior en-Kor
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Warrior en-Kor this turn is dealt to target creature you control instead.
cards.originalText: {0}: Redirect 1 damage from Warrior en-Kor to a creature you control.
cards.flavor: Only a matter as vital as destroying Volrath could bring together the reclusive Kor people.

rulings.text: The ability of this card does not do anything to stop Trample damage from being assigned to the defending player.
It can redirect damage to itself.
It is possible to redirect more damage to a creature than that creature's toughness.
You can use this ability as much as you want prior to damage being dealt.
When you redirect combat damage it is still combat damage.

cards.name: Youthful Knight
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.originalText: First strike
cards.flavor:
"Let no child be without a sword. We will all fight, for if we fail, we will certainly all die."
—Oracle en-Vec
